title: Where do we use definite articles? - Quora

response.answer_text: The definite article in the English Language is “THE.” Actually, the definite article “the” is a determiner or specifier which modifies nouns and noun phrases. Note that the definite article is used with singular nouns and plural nouns. Look at some illustrative examples of the usage of the definite article “the.” THE DEFINITE ARTICLE USED WITH A NOUN. EXAMPLES: John is “the man” whom I love. (John is the man I love). Jeff is ”the boy” who scored the a goal. THE DEFINITE ARTICLE USED WITH A NOUN PHRASE. EXAMPLES: “The tall boy” is the one whom I love. ( The tall boy is the one I love). Joanna is “the beautiful girl” whom I love. (Joanna is the beautiful girl I love). THE DEFINITE ARTICLE USED WITH NOUNS. EXAMPLES: These are ”the players” in my team. They are “the students “in my class. THE DEFINITE ARTICLE USED WITH NOUN PHRASES. EXAMPLES: These are “the tall players” in my team. Those are “the smart students” in my class. In sum, the definite article “the” is used with both nouns and noun phrases.
